newsitem.title: ITALY: Ansaldo talking with Daewoo - minister.
newsitem.headline: Ansaldo talking with Daewoo - minister.

text.p: Italy's industry minister Luigi Bersani on Tuesday confirmed that energy group Ansaldo, part of state-controlled Finmeccanica, was studying the possibility of co-operation with South Korea's Daewoo.
Bersani said while attending a conference here that he had had a meeting with Daewoo chairman Kim Woo-Choong, and added it was clear that Daewoo and Ansaldo had complementary industrial areas.

He also regarded as positive the interest from chairman Heinrich Von Pierer of German electronics and engineering group Siemens in the privatisation of Italy's defence and engineering group Finmeccanica.
Milan financial daily Il Sole 24 Ore reported on Tuesday that Von Pierer had expressed interest in the planned privatisation of Finmeccanica.
Finmeccanica and Siemens have been co-operating since 1992 in the areas of railway equipment and gas turbines.
